div.div:
Docs: Add documentation for SingleEventEffect composable function
This commit adds comprehensive documentation for the `SingleEventEffect` composable function, explaining its purpose, usage, and parameters.
- Adds a detailed KDoc comment describing the function's functionality, including its handling of single events and lifecycle awareness. - Provides a usage example to illustrate how to integrate the function into a composable. - Documents all parameters and their expected types.

Refactor: Improve Login screen UI and logic
This commit improves the Login screen by integrating reusable UI components and refining logic:
- Replaces `OutlinedTextField ` with `AppTextField` and `AppPasswordTextField` for a consistent look and feel. - Updates the UI action `SetEmail` to `SetUserName` for better clarity. - Modifies the password field's IME action to move focus to the username field if it's blank, enhancing user experience. - Modifies the login functionality to use a single event effect for UI updates. - Updates default login credentials for testing purposes.

Feat: Add show/hide strings to design system
This commit adds string resources for "show" and "hide" to the design system.
- Adds `hide` string. - Adds `show` string with a newline character.

Feat: Introduce AppPasswordTextField and supporting components
This commit introduces a new password text field component with show/hide functionality.
- Adds `AppPasswordTextField ` composable for password input with a toggle to show/hide the password. - Introduces `AppStandardIconButton` for general-purpose icon buttons. - Creates `AppIcon` object to hold common app icons. - Adds `ThemePreviews` and `DevicePreviews` annotations for previewing composables in different themes and devices. - Includes a basic `AppTextField` composable for standard text input.

Refactor: Restructure theme components
This commit restructures the theme components by organizing them into separate packages for color, device type, dimensions, shape, and typography.
- Introduces new packages: `color`, `device_type`, `dimen`, `shape`, and `type` under the `theme` package. - Moves existing theme components to their respective packages. - Updates the `SplitkarleTheme` to use the reorganized components. - Removes old `Color`, `DeviceType`, `Dimen`, `Theme`, and `Type` files. - Adds new `AppTheme`, `AppShapes`, `AppTypography`, `Shapes`, and `Type` files.

Refactor: Improve error handling in SafeApiCall
This commit improves error handling in `SafeApiCall` by including the error message and response data from the `BaseResponse` in the `ApiResponse.Failure`.
- Updates `SafeApiCall` to extract the error message and response data from `BaseResponse`. - Modifies `BaseResponse` to include a `message` field for providing error details.

Feat: Introduce adaptive dimensions and device type detection
This commit introduces adaptive dimensions and device type detection for UI responsiveness.
- It adds `Dimen` data class to manage dimensions based on device type and screen size. - Introduces functions to calculate scaling factors and provide appropriate dimensions. - Creates `LocalDimen` and `LocalDeviceType` CompositionLocals for accessing these values in composables. - Integrates these features into the `SplitkarleTheme` to automatically adapt dimensions.

Feat: Introduce DeviceType and Screen dimension enums
This commit introduces new enums: `DeviceType`, `ScreenWidthType`, and `ScreenHeightType` to categorize devices based on their screen dimensions. These enums help in adapting UI layouts based on screen size and orientation. It also introduces a `LocalDeviceType` compositionLocal to make device type information accessible in composables.

Refactor: Rename ActionEvent to UIAction
Renamed `ActionEvent` to `UIAction` for better clarity and consistency in the UI layer. This change updates the base `ViewModel` and related components in the authentication module to reflect the new naming convention.
